name: Automatiser les commandes d'achat PDF en commandes de vente dans Adobe Commerce avec l'IA
description:
# üìÑ Automatisation PDF-√†-Commande pour Magento2 (Adobe commerce / open source)

## Description
Ce mod√®le n8n d√©montre comment traiter automatiquement les **commandes d'achat PDF** re√ßues par e-mail et les convertir en **commandes de vente dans Adobe Commerce (Magento 2)** en utilisant **Cr√©dit d'Entreprise** comme m√©thode de paiement.  

Cela est particuli√®rement utile pour les **entreprises B2B** recevant des commandes structur√©es de clients par e-mail.  

**Les cas d'utilisation incluent :**  
- Automatisation des commandes B2B entrantes  
- R√©duction de la saisie manuelle pour les √©quipes de vente  
- Assurer une cr√©ation rapide de commandes dans Adobe Commerce  
- Gestion fiable des erreurs et validation des clients  

---

## Bon √† savoir
- Ce flux de travail est con√ßu pour **Adobe Commerce**, utilisant la m√©thode de paiement **Cr√©dit d'Entreprise**.  
- Il n√©cessite que le client ait d√©j√† un compte dans Adobe Commerce et soit autoris√© √† utiliser le Cr√©dit d'Entreprise.  
- Le m√™me flux peut √™tre facilement adapt√© pour d'autres m√©thodes de paiement (par exemple, Bon de Commande, Virement Bancaire).  
- Aucun service tiers n'est requis en dehors de **n8n** et d'un acc√®s √† Adobe Commerce avec des identifiants API.  

---

## Comment √ßa fonctionne
1. **D√©clencheur** ‚Üí Surveille une bo√Æte de r√©ception e-mail pour les e-mails entrants avec des pi√®ces jointes PDF.  
2. **Extraire PDF** ‚Üí T√©l√©charge le PDF joint et analyse les donn√©es de commande (par exemple, SKU, quantit√©, r√©f√©rence client).  
3. **Valider le Client** ‚Üí V√©rifie si l'exp√©diteur correspond √† un client existant dans Adobe Commerce et v√©rifie l'√©ligibilit√© au Cr√©dit d'Entreprise.  
4. **Cr√©er Commande** ‚Üí G√©n√®re une nouvelle commande dans Magento en utilisant les donn√©es de produit extraites et le Cr√©dit d'Entreprise.  
5. **G√©rer les Erreurs** ‚Üí Enregistre les probl√®mes et peut notifier un canal d√©sign√© (e-mail, Slack, etc.) si quelque chose ne va pas.  
6. **Am√©liorations Optionnelles** ‚Üí Ajouter des journaux √† Airtable, envoyer des confirmations aux clients, ou attacher les donn√©es de commande analys√©es aux entr√©es CRM.  

---

## Comment utiliser
- Un d√©clencheur manuel est inclus comme exemple, mais vous pouvez le remplacer par un **D√©clencheur Email IMAP**, **D√©clencheur Gmail**, ou **Webhook**, selon votre configuration.  
- Personnalisez le n≈ìud **analyseur PDF** pour s'adapter √† votre mise en page de document sp√©cifique et √† la structure des champs.  
- Configurez les **identifiants API d'Adobe Commerce** dans les n≈ìuds HTTP (ou utilisez des variables d'environnement).  
- Connectez √©ventuellement les √©tapes d'erreur √† **Slack**, **Email**, ou **tableaux de bord** pour le suivi.  

---

## Exigences
- ‚úÖ Instance n8n (auto-h√©berg√©e ou cloud)  
- ‚úÖ Instance Adobe Commerce (Magento 2) avec acc√®s API et Cr√©dit d'Entreprise activ√©  
- ‚úÖ Mod√®les PDF structur√©s utilis√©s par vos clients  
- (Optionnel) Slack/Email/Airtable pour les notifications et les journaux  

---

## Personnalisation de ce flux de travail
Ce flux de travail peut √™tre adapt√© pour :  
- D'autres m√©thodes de paiement (par exemple, **Bons de Commande**, **Paiement en Ligne**)  
- Magento open source pr√™t. Utilisez simplement votre propre m√©thode de paiement  
- Sources de commande alternatives (par exemple, t√©l√©charger des PDF via un portail au lieu d'un e-mail)  
- Analyse d'autres formats de documents (par exemple, **CSV, Excel**)  
- Int√©gration directe dans des **syst√®mes ERP**  

---

assignments.name: message

parameters.text:
=Please extract the following information from the text as valid json.:

"email" (array with all email adresses found. Add ALL found email addresses!)
"po_number"
"express" (true or false when express shipping is requested)

"address" (skip any address from ourselves, ...), which contains the following fields:
"first_name" (dash if empty)
"last_name" (dash if empty)
"company_name"
"street" (without housenumber)
"housenumber"
"zipcode"
"city" (make sure this city really exist in the country that is also extracted)
"country_code": 2 digit country code
"phone_number": can only contains a + in the beginning, dashes or spaces. Remove any other characters!

An array with "products" that contains:
articlenumber: Remove any addition Extract the line items from the following purchase order text, making sure to include the full article number exactly as it appears in the text ‚Äî including any leading characters or digits. Do not omit or alter any part of the article number. 
quantity
price

After all the products, add ALL extra fields and their values in their original language when found within an object "extra_fields"!

This is a template of how the output should be:
{
  "email": [
    ""
  ],
  "po_number": "",
  "express": true,
  "address": {
    "first_name": "",
    "last_name": "",
    "company_name": "",
    "street": "",
    "housenumber": "",
    "zipcode": "",
    "city": "",
    "country_code": "",
    "phone_number": ""
  },
  "products": [
    {
      "articlenumber": "",
      "condition": "",
      "quantity": 2,
      "price": 1455.75
    }
  ],
  "extra_fields": {  }
}

This is the information:
{{ $json.info }}

parameters.content:
# üì© 1. Trigger & Input
## This section retrieves emails and extracts PDF attachments.

Monitors the Outlook mailbox for incoming purchase order emails.
Automatically downloads PDF attachments.
Combines email body text and PDF data into a single data stream.
Prepares raw order information for AI-based parsing

# üìù AI Parsing & Normalisation & Checks
## Parse PDF with AI, clean product data and filter emails.

Sends email and PDF content to Azure OpenAI for parsing.
Extracts key fields such as PO number, customer data, and product list into structured JSON.
Cleans product article numbers (e.g. removing SCH prefixes or unwanted suffixes).
Filters out invalid or irrelevant email addresses from the extracted data.
Ensures no duplicate or invalid orders are created.

# üë§ Customer Validation
## Check if customer exists, validate addresses and company credit.

Searches for the customer in Adobe Commerce using the extracted email address.
Verifies if the customer account exists in the webshop.
Retrieves and checks the default shipping address.
Provides feedback if no valid customer or default address is found.

# üõí Cart Creation & Products
## Create cart, add products, remove duplicates and prepare order.

Creates a new empty shopping cart (quote) for the validated customer.
Clears any existing items from the customer‚Äôs cart.
Iterates over each parsed product and adds it to the cart.
Validates SKU and availability in Adobe Commerce.
Logs feedback if products are missing or cannot be added.

# üöö Shipping & Billing
## Set billing and shipping addresses, estimate methods, apply standard/express.

Sets the billing address in the cart.
Estimates available shipping methods.
Applies either the standard or express shipping method based on extracted order data.
Ensures shipping information is correctly linked to the quote.

# ‚úÖ Finalize Order
## Set PO number, add order comments, validate payment and place order.

Validates and sets the Purchase Order number in the cart.
Adds an internal order comment for traceability.
Retrieves available payment methods and checks for Company Credit.
Places the final order in Adobe Commerce using Company Credit.
Moves the processed email into the ‚ÄúProcessed Orders‚Äù folder.

# ‚ö†Ô∏è Error Handling
## Fallback nodes to catch and log errors, feedback messages, and move processed email.

Stops the workflow gracefully if critical data is missing.
Provides clear feedback messages (e.g. ‚ÄúNo customer found‚Äù, ‚ÄúNo PO number‚Äù, ‚ÄúCompany Credit not available‚Äù).
Sends structured error output for notifications or monitoring.

assignments.name: message
assignments.value:
=No product with specified price found, or requested stock is not available for sku(s):
{{ $json.combined }}

assignments.name: message
assignments.value:
=The following product(s) are added to the order:
{{ $json.combined }}

parameters.content:
# üìÑ PDF-to-Order Automation for Magento2 (Adobe commerce / open source)

## Description
This n8n template demonstrates how to automatically process **PDF purchase orders** received via email and convert them into **sales orders in Adobe Commerce (Magento 2)** using **Company Credit** as the payment method.  

This is especially useful for **B2B companies** receiving structured orders from clients by email.  

**Use cases include:**  
- Automating incoming B2B orders  
- Reducing manual entry for sales teams  
- Ensuring fast order creation in Adobe Commerce  
- Reliable error handling and customer validation  

---

## Good to know
- This workflow is tailored for **Adobe Commerce**, using the **Company Credit** payment method.  
- It requires that the customer already has an account in Adobe Commerce and is authorized to use Company Credit.  
- The same flow can be easily adapted for other payment methods (e.g. Purchase Order, Bank Transfer).  
- No third-party services are required aside from **n8n** and access to Adobe Commerce with API credentials.  

---

## How it works
1. **Trigger** ‚Üí Monitors an email inbox for incoming emails with PDF attachments.  
2. **Extract PDF** ‚Üí Downloads the attached PDF and parses order data (e.g. SKU, quantity, customer reference).  
3. **Validate Customer** ‚Üí Checks if the sender matches an existing customer in Adobe Commerce and verifies Company Credit eligibility.  
4. **Create Order** ‚Üí Generates a new order in Magento using the extracted product data and Company Credit.  
5. **Handle Errors** ‚Üí Logs issues and can notify a designated channel (email, Slack, etc.) if something goes wrong.  
6. **Optional Enhancements** ‚Üí Add logging to Airtable, send confirmations to customers, or attach parsed order data to CRM entries.  

---

## How to use
- A manual trigger is included as an example, but you can replace it with an **IMAP Email Trigger**, **Gmail Trigger**, or **Webhook**, depending on your setup.  
- Customize the **PDF parser** node to fit your specific document layout and field structure.  
- Configure **Adobe Commerce API credentials** in the HTTP nodes (or use environment variables).  
- Optionally connect error steps to **Slack**, **Email**, or **dashboards** for monitoring.  

---

## Requirements
- ‚úÖ n8n instance (self-hosted or cloud)  
- ‚úÖ Adobe Commerce (Magento 2) instance with API access and Company Credit enabled  
- ‚úÖ Structured PDF templates used by your customers  
- (Optional) Slack/Email/Airtable for notifications and logs  

---

## Customising this workflow
This workflow can be adapted for:  
- Other payment methods (e.g. **Purchase Orders**, **Online Payment**)  
- Alternate order sources (e.g. uploading PDFs via a portal instead of email)  
- Parsing other document formats (e.g. **CSV, Excel**)  
- Direct integration into **ERP systems**  

---

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

data.details: The Execute Workflow node can be used when you want your workflow to treat another workflow as a step in your flow. It allows you to modularize your workflows and have a single source of truth for series of actions you perform often.
